definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: I'm one hundred percent sure he's falling in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 我百分之百肯定他愛上了你。

sentences.english: We allow one percent for leakage.
sentences.chinese: 我們少算百分之一作爲漏損。

sentences.english: Action figures and games & puzzles saw increases of four per cent and one per cent.
sentences.chinese: 動畫人物和遊戲及拼圖看到了百分之百分之一4增加。

sentences.english: Besides copyright, the writer got a 10-percent royalty on sales.
sentences.chinese: 除擁有版權外，作者得到百分之十的版稅。

sentences.english: Now, more than 60 percent of kindergarteners attend for a full day.
sentences.chinese: 而現在，超過百分之六十的幼兒參加了全託。

sentences.english: In nineteen eighty, the American divorce rate was about fifty percent.
sentences.chinese: 在一九八四，美國的離婚率是百分之五十左右。

sentences.english: Sixty percent of the examinee were very satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 百分之六十的考生都非常的滿意。

sentences.english: As a result, a fuel-saving potential of up to eight per cent is possible.
sentences.chinese: 因此，節油潛力高達百分之八，是可能的。

sentences.english: Plateaus and mountains make up 60 per cent of China's total area.
sentences.chinese: 高原和山地佔中國總面積的百分之六十。

sentences.english: 99 percent of lawyers give the rest a bad name.
sentences.chinese: 百分之九十九的律師是毀壞律師界名聲的大老鼠。

sentences.english: The overall sales of the wholesalers increased by 10%.
sentences.chinese: 批發商的總銷售額增加了百分之十。

sentences.english: Up to 80 percent of the historic centers of German cities were destroyed by Allied bombs during the war.
sentences.chinese: 達百分之八十的德國城市的歷史中心遭到聯合轟炸。

sentences.english: You must allow for five per cent wastage in transit.
sentences.chinese: 在運輸中要考慮到有百分之五的損耗量。

sentences.english: For the first time, we’ve begun screening 100 percent of southbound rail shipments.
sentences.chinese: 我們首次開始對南去的鐵路運輸實行百分之百的檢查。

sentences.english: This risk is coverable at a premium of 0.25%.
sentences.chinese: 該險別的保險費是百分之零點二五。

sentences.english: Have a regulatory capital adequacy ratio of 200 percent or higher for the half-year period immediately prior to the date of application.
sentences.chinese: 申請日前半年自有資本適足比率應達百分之二百以上。

definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
